src_text: Cabinet has approved the Policy Framework for Integrated Planning in government, which seeks to address the identified policy planning gaps in the current planning system.
tgt_text: Mivhigo ḓo bveledzwa nga kotara nahone ya anḓadzwa luvhili nga ṅwaha..     Muhanga wa Mbekanyamaitele ya Vhupulani ho Ṱanganelaho.

src_text: The proposed interventions will amongst others deal with the lack of planning alignment within the three spheres of government.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza Muhanga wa Mbekanyamaitele ya Vhupulani ho Ṱanganelaho kha muvhuso, une wa khou lingedza tandulula thaidzo dzo ṱaluswaho dza zwa vhupulani ha mbekanyamaitele kha sisteme ya zwa vhupulani ya zwino.

src_text: The interventions will introduce an evidence-based monitoring mechanism.
tgt_text: Maga ane khou dzinginywa ḓo dovha hafhu sedzesa kha zwa sa elana ha vhupulani kha masia mararu muvhuso.

src_text: The policy framework also introduces easier predictability with long to medium and short-term planning across government.
tgt_text: Maga aya ḓo thoma shumisa maitele zwa vhulavhelesi ḓitikaho nga vhuṱanzi.

src_text: It will work towards introducing legislative reforms to improve coherency and predictability in government planning and monitoring..
tgt_text: Muhanga wa mbekanyamaitele dovha hafhu wa thoma shumisa nḓila yo leluwaho ya khumbulelo ine ya vha na vhupulani ha tshifhinga tshilapfu ya kha tsha vhukati na ha tshifhinga tshipfufhi kha mihasho ḓo dovha hafhu wa shuma wo livha kha bveledza maga u shandukisa milayo hu tshi itelwa khwinifhadza zwa elana na humbulela kha zwa vhupulani na vhulavhelesi ha muvhuso.

src_text: Ratification of the Treaty for the Establishment of the African Medicines Agency (AMA).
tgt_text: Khwaṱhisedzo ya Thendelano ya Thomiwa ha Zhendedzi ḽa zwa Mishonga ḽa Afrika (AMA).

src_text: Cabinet approved the signing of the Treaty for the Establishment of the AMA and its submission to Parliament for ratification.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza sainwa ha Thendelano ya thomiwa ha AMA khathihi na ṋetshedzwa hayo kha Phalamennde uri kone khwaṱhisedzwa.

src_text: This will give effect to the treaty that was adopted by the African Union Assembly in.
tgt_text: Hezwi zwi ḓo ita uri thendelano dze dza ṱanganezwa nga Guvhangano ḽa Mbumbano ya Afrika nga ṅwaha wa 2019 dzi thome shuma.

src_text: The treaty formally establishes the AMA for the continent.
tgt_text: Thendelano idzi ndi dzine dza ḓo ita uri hu mbo ḓi thoma vhumbwa AMA ya dzhango ḽa Afrika lwa tshiofisi.

src_text: The agency will regulate medical products, and improve the safety and efficacy of the medical products for the continent.
tgt_text: Zhendedzi iḽi ḽi ḓo langa zwibveledzwa zwa mishonga khathihi na khwinifhadza tsireledzea na shuma zwavhuḓi ha zwibveledzwa zwa mishonga kha dzhango.

src_text: The signing and ratifying of this treaty will advance South Africa’s global and continental commitment toward strengthening the continental regulatory system on its health products..  Report on the Performance of the Research and Development (R&D) Tax Incentive Programme – 2019/20 and 2020/.
tgt_text: Uhu sainwa na khwaṱhisedzwa ha thendelano idzi hu ḓo engedza vhuḓiimiseli ha shango ḽa Afrika Tshipembe ḽifhasini na kha dzhango ḽa Afrika ho livhiswaho kha khwaṱhisa sisteme ya zwa milayo ya dzhango kha zwibveledzwa zwaḽo zwa mishonga..     Muvhigo nga ha Mashumele Mbekanyamushumo ya Magavhelo Muthelo wa zwa Ṱhoḓisiso na Mveledziso (R&D) – wa 2019/20 na 2020/.

src_text: Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the R&D Tax incentive Programme for the past two years (2019/20 and 2020/21).
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza zwa ṋetshedzwa ngei Phalamenndeni ha Mbekanyamushumo ya Magavhelo Muthelo wa miṅwaha mivhili yo fhelaho (2019/20 na 2020/21).

src_text: This is in line with section 11D (17) of the Income Tax Act, 1962 (Act 58 1962), which requires the tabling of these reports in Parliament.
tgt_text: Hezwi zwi khou elana na khethekanyo 11D (17) ya Mulayo wa Muthelo wa Mbuelo, wa 1962 (Mulayo 58 wa 1962), une wa lavhelela uri hu ṋetshedzwe mivhigo iyi ngomu Phalamenndeni.

src_text: The tax incentive programme seeks to encourage private companies to invest in R&D so as to stimulate investment growth.
tgt_text: Mbekanyamushumo ya magavhelo muthelo ndi ine ya khou lingedza ṱuṱuwedza khamphani dza phuraivethe uri dzi ite zwa vhubindudzi kha R&D hu itela ṱuṱuwedza nyaluwo ya vhubindudzi dovha hafhu ya ita uri hu vhe na mvelaphanḓa ya zwa saintsi na vhukoni yo livhiswaho kha nyaluwo ya ikonomi khathihi na ṱuṱuwedza mashumele maimo nṱha.

src_text: It enables the advancement of science and innovation towards economic growth, and promotes competitiveness.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo takadzwa nga fhungo ḽa uri muvhigo sumbedza uri khamphani ntswa dzo ita khumbelo dza magavhelo muthelo khou dovha hafhu ya ṱuṱuwedza uri khamphani dzi swikele tshikimu itshi nga vhunzhi sa tshipiḓa tsha engedza vhubindudzi nga fhambana hadzo khathihi na ṱuṱuwedza nyaluwo ya ikonomi.

src_text: Cabinet is pleased that the report shows that new companies have applied for the tax incentive.
It encourages more companies to access this scheme as part of growing their respective investment and stimulating economic growth.
tgt_text: Khamphani nṋa khulwane dze dza swikela aya magavhelo muthelo ndi dzine dza vha kha sekhithara ya dzudzanya zwibveledzwa zwa vhulimi; ya shandukisa zwibveledzwa zwa migodini; ya dzikhemikhaḽa; ya lunako; ya mishonga na ya shumisa muḓagasi kha zwa thekhinoḽodzhi khathihi na sekhithara dza Thekhinoḽodzhi ya Mafhungo dze khabinethe ya dzi khwaṱhisedza sa dza ndeme kha Pulane ya Shuma ya Mbekanyamaitele ya zwa Nḓowetshumo.

src_text: The top-four companies that accessed the tax incentive are in agro-processing; mining beneficiation; chemicals, cosmetics, pharmaceutical and electro-technical and Information Technology sectors that Cabinet endorsed as priority areas in the Industrial Policy Action Plan.
tgt_text: Muvhigo wo fhelelaho nga kona swikelwa nga kha webusaithi ya Muhasho wa Saintsi na Vhukoni ine ya vha: www.dst.gov.za..     Foramu ya Mulayo wa Nyaluwo na Zwikhala wa Afrika (AGOA) –.

src_text: The full report can be accessed through the Department of Science and Innovation website: www.dst.gov.za..  African Growth and Opportunity Act (AGOA) Forum –.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza zwa ḓo farwa ha Foramu ya AGOA nga ṅwaha wa.

src_text: Cabinet has approved the hosting of the AGOA Forum in.
tgt_text: AGOA yo phasiswa nga shango ḽa Amerika (USA) nga ṅwaha wa 2000 hu tshi itelwa ṋetshedza tswikelo kha mbambadzo ine wa tou funa nga iwe muṋe kha vhunzhi ha mashango tshipembe ha soga ḽa Sahara khathihi na maraga wa ngomu ha shango ḽa USA.

src_text: AGOA was enacted by the United States of America (USA) in 2000 to provide unilateral trade preferential access for most of the sub-Saharan African countries and the USA domestic market.
tgt_text: Zwibveledzwa zwa Afrika Tshipembe zwine zwa rengiselwa kha mashango nnḓa nga fhasi ha AGOA ndi zwine zwa katela mitshelo, nḓuhu, dzigoloi, zwipiḓa zwa dzigoloi, tsimbi khathihi na zwibveledzwa zwa khemikhaḽa.

src_text: South Africa’s exports under AGOA include edible fruits, nuts, vehicles, auto components, iron, steel and chemical products.
tgt_text: Datumu ya fhedzisela na fhethu hune foramu ya ḓo farelwa hone kha ḓi ḓo ḓivhadzwa.

src_text: The actual date and venue are still to be announced.
tgt_text: Tshigwada tsha nga ha Vhulavhelesi ha Ḽifhasi (GEO) Muṱangano wa Dziminisṱa –.

src_text: Group on Earth Observations (GEO) Ministerial Summit –.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza zwauri Afrika Tshipembe ḽi vhe hone fhethu hune ha ḓo farelwa Muṱangano wa Dziminisṱa wa GEO fhaḽa ḓoroboni ya Cape Town nga ṅwaha wa.

src_text: Cabinet approved that South Africa hosts the GEO Ministerial Summit in Cape Town in.
tgt_text: GEO ndi tshiimiswa tsha vhukati ha mivhuso tshe tsha vhumbwa nga ṅwaha wa 2003 nga murahu ha Muṱangano wa Ḽifhasi wa nga ha Mveledziso ya Tshifhinga Tshilapfu wa ṅwaha wa shuma sa yone nḓila ya masia manzhi ine khayo mashango shela mulenzhe nga tou funa ho livhiwa kha swikela tshipikwa tshithihi tsha bveledza sisteme dza GEO.

src_text: The GEO is an intergovernmental body set up in 2003 after the 2002 World Summit on Sustainable Development.
tgt_text: GEO zwazwino na mashango ane vha miraḓo linganaho 113, hune khao 30 ndi fhano Afrika khathihi na madzangano ane khou shela mulenzhe linganaho 140, hune 11 hone bva fhano kha ḽa Afrika.

src_text: It serves as multilateral platform where countries voluntarily contribute towards common goal of building the GEO systems.
tgt_text: Afrika Tshipembe ḽo ḓi dzulela vha muraḓo wa Khorotshitumbe fhelelaho bva tsha ṅwaha wa 2005 nahone vhorasaintsi vhashu zwazwino vha khou shela mulenzhe kha mishumo minzhi ya zwa ṱhoḓisiso ine ya khou rangwa phanḓa nga GEO.

src_text: The GEO currently has more than 113 national governments, 30 of which are from Africa and about 140 participating organisations, with 11 of these from Africa.
tgt_text: Ṅwedzi wa zwa Vhuendi wa Tshimedzi (OTM) –.

src_text: South Africa has been an active Executive Committee member since 2005 and our scientists are currently participating in number of research initiatives led through the GEO.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza rwelwa ṱari ha fulo ḽa OTM nga Mugivhela, wa ḽa 1 Tshimedzi 2022, nga fhasi ha thero ine ya ri: “Sishov’ingolovane fhaṱisana themamveledziso ya zwa vhuendi ine ya fhaṱa na bveledza nḓila dza ḓitshidza ngadzo dza tshifhinga tshilapfu”.

src_text: October Transport Month (OTM) –.
tgt_text: OTM ya ṅwaha nga ṅwaha shumiswa kha tsivhudza vhathu nga ha vhuendi sa tshiṅwe tsha zwiteṅwa zwa ndeme tsha nyaluwo ya ikonomi na mveledziso ya fhethu.

src_text: Cabinet approved the launching of the OTM campaign on Saturday, 1 October 2022, under the theme: “Sishov’ingolovane: together building transport infrastructure that builds and sustains livelihoods”.
tgt_text: Hu ḓo vha na mishumo minzhi ine ya ḓo itwa itela ṱana zwithu zwo fhambanaho zwa themamveledziso ya vhuendi, zwa kha vhuendi ha muyani, ha lwanzheni, vhuendi ha nnyi na nnyi na dzibada.

src_text: The annual OTM is used to raise awareness on transport as one of the critical elements in economic growth and spatial development number of activities will take place to showcase the various aspects of transport infrastructure in aviation, maritime, public transport and roads.
tgt_text: Mishumo iyi ḓo dovha hafhu ya ṋea tsivhudzo nga ha tsireledzo na vhutsireledzi ha zwishumiswa zwa vhuendi.

src_text: The activities will also raise awareness regarding transport safety and security.
tgt_text: Nyambedzano na vhoṱhe vha kwameaho na dzone dzi ḓo vha hone itela davhidzana nga ha khaedu dzo fhambanaho dzine dza vha hone kha sekhithara ya zwa vhuendi.

src_text: Stakeholder engagements will also be held to discuss various challenges in the transport sector.
tgt_text: Muvhuso kha ḓi vha wo ḓiimisela khwinifhadza themamveledziso ya zwa vhuendi ya shango ḽashu, kha vhupo hoṱhe, ha mahayani na ha dziḓoroboni itela uri hu kone vha na enda ha vhathu na thundu nga nḓila yo leluwaho.

src_text: Government remains committed to improving the country’s transport infrastructure, both in rural and urban areas, so as to facilitate an effective and efficient movement of goods and people..  United Nations (UN) Human Settlement Programme Habitat (UN-HABITAT) Meeting.
Cabinet has approved the hosting of the meeting of the members of the UN-HABITAT in Johannesburg on 16 and 17 October.
tgt_text: Muṱangano wa nga ha Mbekanyamushumo ya Vhudzulo ha Vhathu (UN-HABITAT) ya Dzangano ḽa Vhuthihi ha Dzitshaka (UN).
Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza zwa farwa ha muṱangano wa miraḓo ya UN-HABITAT fhaḽa ḓoroboni ya Johannesburg nga ḽa 16 na 17 Tshimedzi.

src_text: The Department of Human Settlements will coordinate this two-day meeting to be attended by political champions, practitioners and researchers, including key members of the Committee of Permanent Representatives of the UN-HABITAT based in Nairobi, Kenya.
Key issues to be discussed will include seeking transformational interventions for informal settlements and slums..
tgt_text: Muhasho wa Vhudzulo ha Vhathu ḓo vha wone une wa ḓo tshimbidza hoyu muṱangano wa maḓuvha mavhili une wa ḓo dzhenelwa nga mazhakanḓila zwa polotiki, vhaḓivhi na vhaṱoḓisisi, hu tshi katelwa na miraḓo mihulwane ya Komiti ya Vhaimeleli vha Tshoṱhe vha tshiimiswa tsha UN-HABITAT tshine tsha vha fhaḽa ḓoroboni ya Nairobi, kha ḽa Kenya.

src_text: The outcomes of these deliberations will culminate in the launching of the Global Action Plan Framework, which will be tabled in the UN-HABITAT Assembly for endorsement in  Bills.
tgt_text: Mafhungo ndeme ane ḓo ambiwa nga hao ḓo katela wana maga tshandukiso ya vhudzulo ha mikhukhuni na mishasha.

src_text: National Council on Gender-Based Violence and Femicide (GBVF) Bill of.
Cabinet approved the submission of the National Council on GBVF Bill of 2021 to Parliament for processing.
tgt_text: Mvelelo dza nyambedzano idzi ndi dzone dzine dza ḓo itisa uri hu vhe na rwelwa ṱari ha Muhanga wa Pulane ya Mashumele ya Ḽifhasi, ine ya ḓo ḓivhadzwa kha muṱangano wa Guvhangano ḽa UN-HABITAT hu tshi itelwa uri dzi khwaṱhisedzwe nga ṅwaha wa     Milayotibe.

src_text: This Bill provides legislative framework for the establishment of the statutory body to provide focus intervention in dealing with GBVF.
tgt_text: Mulayotibe wa nga ha Khakhathi dzo Ḓitikaho nga Mbeu khathihi na Mabulayo Vhathu vha Tshifumakadzi wa Khoro ya Lushaka (GBVF) wa ṅwaha wa.

src_text: It also provides for the establishment of the Board of the Council that will provide strategic leadership and oversee the implementation of the National Strategic Plan on GBVF, which was approved by Cabinet in October 2020 for implementation.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza ṋetshedzwa ha Mulayotibe wa GBVF wa Khoro ya Lushaka wa ṅwaha wa 2021 ngei Phalamenndeni itela uri kone dzudzanywa.

src_text: The board will have 51% representation from civil society and 49% from government.
tgt_text: Mulayotibe uyu ṋetshedza muhanga wa zwa milayo ya vhumbiwa ha tshiimiswa tsha mulayo hu tshi itelwa maga u dzhenelela nga nḓila yo khwaṱhaho kha nndwa ya lwa na zwiito zwa GBVF dovha hafhu wa vha na mbetshelwa dza vhumbiwa ha Bodo ya Khoro ine ya ḓo ṋetshedza vhurangaphanḓa ha ndeme khathihi na vhona uri hu khou thoma shumiswa Maga Khwaṱhaho Lushaka u Lwa na Zwiito zwa GBVF a ṱanganedzwa nga Khabinethe nga ṅwedzi wa Tshimedzi 2020 hu tshi itelwa uri thome shumiswa.

src_text: The Bill has already gone through public consultation..  Tobacco Products and Electronic Delivery Systems Control Bill of.
tgt_text: Bodo ḓo vha na vhuimeleli ha 51% bva kha vhadzulapo ngeno ha 49% vhu tshi ḓo bva kha muvhuso.

src_text: Cabinet approved the submission of the Tobacco Products and Electronic Delivery Systems Control Bill of 2018 to Parliament, which seeks to repeal the current Tobacco Products Control Act, 1993 (Act 83 of 1993), as amended.
tgt_text: Mulayotibe wo no ḓi fhira nga fhasi ha maitele vhukwamani na vhadzulapo..     Zwibveledzwa zwa Mafola na Mulayotibe wa Ndangulo ya Sisteme dza Nḓisedzo ya Eḽekhiṱhironiki wa ṅwaha wa.

src_text: The Bill also seeks to strengthen the country’s public health measures and align them with the World Health Organisation Framework Convention on Tobacco Control.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza ṋetshedzwa ha Mulayotibe wa Zwibveledzwa zwa Mafola na Ndangulo ya Sisteme ya Nḓisedzo ya Eḽekhiṱhironiki wa ṅwaha wa 2018 kha Phalamennde, une wa vha wone une wa khou ḓo phumula Mulayo wa Ndangulo ya Zwibveledzwa zwa Mafola, wa 1993 (Mulayo 83 wa 1993) une wa vha hone zwazwino ya nga he wa khwinifhadzwa ngaho.

src_text: The Bill proposes, among others, 100% smoke-free indoor and some outdoor areas ban on the sale of cigarettes through vending machines, and strengthens cigarette packaging and warning signage.
tgt_text: Mulayotibe khou dovha hafhu wa ṱoḓa khwaṱhisa maga zwa mutakalo wa tshitshavha shango khathihi na ita uri elane na Thendelano dza Muhanga wa Dzangano ḽa Mutakalo ḽa Ḽifhasi kha zwa Ndangulo ya Mafola.

src_text: The Bill has gone through extensive consultation with various stakeholders, including the tobacco industry, civil-society organisations and relevant government departments  Upcoming Events.
tgt_text: Zwiṅwe zwa zwine mulayotibe uyu wa khou dzinginya zwone, ndi vhupo ha nga nnḓa kana ha nga ngomu ha zwifhaṱo vhune khaho ha sa tendelwe zwa daha mafola nga nḓila yo fhelelaho;  nyiledzo kha zwa rengiswa ha sigareṱe hu tshi shumiswa mitshini ine ya vha yone ṋetshedzaho sigareṱe dzenedzo khathihi na khwaṱhisa zwa tswayo dza tsivhudzo kha phakhethe dza sigareṱe.

src_text: 77th Session of the UN General Assembly (UNGA77).
tgt_text: Mulayotibe wo pfukha nga fhasi ha maitele khwaṱhaho zwa vhukwamani na vhoṱhe vha kwameaho nga fhambana havho, hu tshi katelwa na vha nḓowetshumo ya mafola, madzangano vhadzulapo khathihi na mihasho ya muvhuso kwameaho     Vhuṱambo vhune ha khou ḓa.

src_text: South Africa is participating in the UNGA77 taking place at the UN headquarters in New York City in the USA from 20 to 27 September 2022 under the theme: “A watershed moment: Unlocking transformative solutions to interlocking challenges”.
tgt_text: Dzulo ḽa vhu77 ḽa Guvhangano ḽa Nnyi na Nnyi ḽa Dzangano ḽa Vhuthihi ha Dzitshaka (UNGA77).

src_text: For the global South, the economic and socio-economic impact of the Coronavirus Disease (COVID-19) pandemic has been disproportionate in relation to recovery in the developed North and this requires united effort from all nations to ensure no one is left behind..
tgt_text: Afrika Tshipembe ḽi khou shela mulenzhe kha dzulo ḽa UNGA77 ḽine ḽa khou farelwa fhaḽa musanda wa UN une wa vha Ḓoroboni ya New York kha ḽa Amerika bva nga ḽa 20 swika ḽa 27 Khubvumedzi 2022 nga fhasi ha thero ine ya ri: “Tshikhala tsha ndeme vulela thandululo dza ḓisa tshanduko dza valela khaedu”.

src_text: Preceding the UN General Debate, the UN Secretary-General, Mr António Guterres, will convene summit on “Transforming Education” and host high-level meeting focusing on the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs).
tgt_text: Kha sia ḽa Tshipembe ha ḽifhasi ḽoṱhe, masiandaitwa kha zwa ikonomi na kha ikonomi na matshilisano ḓiswaho nga Dwadze ḽa Khoronavairasi (COVID-19) ḓi wanala sa lingani musi ho sedzwa luvhilo lwa mbuedzedzo musi tshi vhambedzwa na re kha sia ḽo bvelelaho ḽa Devhula nahone hezwi zwi ṱoḓa uri hu vhe na farisana vhukati ha tshaka dzoṱhe itela uri hu si vhe na ane salela murahu.

src_text: The SDGs meeting is expected to explore ways in which to regain momentum and accelerate their implementation.
Heritage Day.
tgt_text: Phanḓa ha Nyambedzano dza Nnyi na Nnyi dza UN, Muṅwaleli Muhulwane wa UN, Vho António Guterres, vha ḓo vhidza muṱangano wa nga ha “Tshandukiso ya Pfunzo” nahone vha ḓo dovha vha tshimbidza muṱangano wa vhurumelwa ha maimo nṱha une wa ḓo vha wo lavhelesa nga maanḓa kha Zwipikwa zwa Mveledziso ya Tshifhinga Tshilapfu (SDGs).

src_text: President Ramaphosa will deliver keynote address at the 2022 National Heritage Day celebrations at the Union Buildings on Saturday, 24 September.
tgt_text: Hoyu muṱangano wa SDG khou lavhelelwa uri ḓo sedzesa kha zwa wana hafhu nḓila dza vhuisa nungo khathihi na engedza luvhilo lwa ita uri tshanduko idzi dza pfunzo dzi thome shumiswa.

src_text: The event will be held under the theme: “Celebrating the Legacy of Solomon Linda and South Africa’s Indigenous Music”..
This year’s Heritage Month focuses on South Africa’s indigenous music with spotlight on isicathamiya music and its immense contribution to our sport, arts, culture and heritage.
tgt_text: Ḓuvha ḽa Vhufa.

src_text: The theme pays tribute to the 60th anniversary of the passing of musician, singer and composer Solomon Popoli Linda (1909-1962), also known as Solomon Ntsele, who is best known as the composer of the song, “Mbube”.
tgt_text: Phresidennde Vho Ramaphosa vha ḓo ṋetshedza tshipitshi tshavho tshihulwane kha vhuṱambo ha pembelela Ḓuvha ḽa Vhufa ḽa Lushaka ḽa ṅwaha wa 2022 fhaḽa Union Buildings nga Mugivhela, wa ḽa 24 Khubvumedzi.

src_text: 2022 World Maritime Day Parallel Event .
tgt_text: Vhuṱambo vhu ḓo farwa nga fhasi ha thero ine ya ri: “U pembelela Vhufa ha Vho Solomon Linda na Muzika Wapo wa Afrika Tshipembe”..     Ṅwedzi wa Vhufa wa uno ṅwaha wo sedzesa kha muzika wapo wa fhano Afrika Tshipembe, nga maanḓa ho lavheleseswa kha muzika wa Isicathamiya khathihi na nḓila ye wa shela ngayo mulenzhe kha mitambo yashu, vhutsila, mvelele na vhufa.

src_text: South Africa will be hosting the 2022 World Maritime Day Parallel Event in Durban from 12 to 14 October.
tgt_text: Thero iyi fhululedza miṅwaha ya 60 nga murahu ha lovha ha ramuzika, muimbi na muṅwali wa muzika Vho Solomon Popoli Linda (1909-1962), vhe vha vha vha tshi ḓivhiwa hafhu sa Vho Solomon Ntsele, vhane vha ḓivhea vhukuma sa ene muṅwali wa luimbo lu no pfi, “Mbube”.

src_text: The event will be hosted during the OTM, which will also form part of raising awareness of our maritime sector.
tgt_text: Vhuṱambo ha nga Thungo ha Ḓuvha ḽa zwa Lwanzheni ḽa Ḽifhasi ha ṅwaha wa 2022  .

src_text: The event will bring delegates from various countries who will experience the South African maritime industry.
tgt_text: Afrika Tshipembe ḽi ḓo vha ḽi tshi khou fara Vhuṱambo ha nga Thungo ha Ḓuvha ḽa zwa Lwanzheni ḽa Ḽifhasi ha ṅwaha fhaḽa ḓoroboni ya Durban bva nga ḽa 12 swika 14 Tshimedzi.

src_text: South Africa has been member of the International Maritime Organization since 1995, which is specialised agency of the UN responsible for regulating shipping..  Tourism Month.
tgt_text: Vhuṱambo uvhu vhu ḓo farwa nga tshifhinga tsha OTM, ine na yone ya ḓo vha tshipiḓa tsha tsivhudza vhathu nga ha sekhithara ya zwa lwanzheni.

src_text: Tourism Month is this year being celebrated under the theme of World Tourism Day (27 September) of “Rethinking Tourism”.
tgt_text: Vhuṱambo uvhu vhu ḓo kuvhanganya vhurumelwa bva kha mashango fhambanaho vhane vha ḓo vha na tshikhala tsha kona vhona nḓowetshumo ya zwa lwanzheni ya ḽa Afrika Tshipembe.

src_text: Domestic tourism is critical in the recovery of the tourism sector, which contributes greatly to the South African GDP and job creation.
tgt_text: Afrika Tshipembe ḽo vha muraḓo wa Dzangano ḽa zwa Lwanzheni ḽa Ḽifhasi bva tsha ṅwaha wa 1995, ḽine ḽa vha zhendedzi ḽo khetheaho ḽa UN ḽine mushumo waḽo wa vha langa matshimbilele zwikepe.

src_text: Cabinet is pleased that the hospitality sector has recorded an increase in visitors post the COVID-19 period.
The.
tgt_text: Ṅwedzi wa zwa Vhuendelamashango.

src_text: 2 million domestic trips taken in the first half of 2022 recorded 114% increase when compared to the same period in.
tgt_text: Ṅwedzi wa zwa Vhuendelamashango wa uno ṅwaha khou pembelelwa nga fhasi ha thero ya Ḓuvha ḽa zwa Vhuendelamashango ḽa Ḽifhasi (27 Khubvumedzi) ine ya ri “U humbula hafhu zwa Vhuendelamashango nga huswa”.

src_text: This showed marked improvement for the same period in 2019, which saw.
tgt_text: Vhuendelamashango ha fhano hayani ndi ha ndeme kha vusuluswa ha sekhithara ya zwa vhuendelamashango ine ya shela mulenzhe zwihulwane kha GDP ya Afrika Tshipembe khathihi na sika mishumo.

src_text: 6 million domestic trips taken.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo takadzwa vhukuma nga fhungo ḽa uri sekhithara ya zwa vhuḓimvumvusi yo rekhoda nyaluwo kha tshivhalo tsha vhaeni kha tshifhinga tsha nga murahu ha dwadze ḽa COVID-.

src_text: As part of celebrating Tourism Month, Cabinet encourages South Africans to undertake ‘Shotleft’ tours to our various provinces.
tgt_text: Nyendo dza ngomu shangoni dzi linganaho.

src_text: Cabinet also welcomed the decision by Air Belgium to fly seasonal flights to South Africa, starting from this month (September), which will boost tourism and further cement our status as tourism destination of choice.
tgt_text: 2 miḽioni dze dza farwa kha tshifhinga tsha hafu ya thoma ya ṅwaha wa 2022 dzo sumbedza nyengedzedzo ya 114% musi dzi tshi vhambedzwa na tshifhinga tshenetsho tshithihi nga ṅwaha wa.

src_text: It will include weekly flights to Cape Town and Johannesburg  Messages.
tgt_text: Hezwi zwo sumbedza khwinifhadzea vhukuma kha idzo dza tshifhinga tshenetsho tshithihi nga ṅwaha wa 2019, he ha vha na nyendo dza ngomu hayani dzi linganaho.

src_text: CongratulationsCabinet extended its congratulations and well-wishes to: President William Samoei Ruto of the Republic of Kenya, who was inaugurated on Tuesday, 13 September 2022, following peaceful national elections held on 9 August.
tgt_text: 6 miḽioni.

src_text: Deputy President David Mabuza attended the inauguration on behalf of President Ramaphosa, and the government and people of the Republic of South Africa.
tgt_text: Sa tshipiḓa tsha pembelela Ṅwedzi wa zwa Vhuendelamashango, Khabinethe khou ṱuṱuwedza vhadzulapo vhoṱhe vha ḽa Afrika Tshipembe uri vha fare nyendo dza ‘Shotleft’ ya kha mavunḓu fhambanaho.

src_text: The South African Rugby Union and the City of Cape Town for successfully hosting the eighth edition of the Rugby World Cup Sevens tournament between 9 and 11 September.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo dovha hafhu ya ṱanganedza tsheo nga vha khamphani ya zwa Vhufhufhi ya Belgium (Air Belgium) ya ḓo vha na mabufho ane ḓo fhufha tshi ḓa fhano Afrika Tshipembe nga zwifhinga thoma kha uno ṅwedzi wa Khubvumedzi, zwine hezwi zwa ḓo khwaṱhisa vhukuma vhuendelamashango khathihi na dovha hafhu zwa khwaṱhisa tshiimo tshashu tsha vha fhethu havhuḓi ha zwa vhuendelamashango.

src_text: This was the first time that this prestigious event was hosted by an African country and the many thousands of fans who attended were treated to feast of rugby and South Africa’s renowned hospitality.
tgt_text: Hezwi zwi ḓo katela mabufho ane ḓo enda vhukati ha ḓorobo ya Kapa na ya Johannesburg nga vhege     Milaedza fhululedza    Khabinethe yo ṱahisa milaedza yayo ya fhululedza na tamela mashudu kha: Phresidennde Vho William Samoei Ruto vha Riphabuḽiki ya Kenya, vhe vha vhewa tshiduloni nga Ḽavhuvhili, ḽa 13 Khubvumedzi 2022, nga murahu ha vha na khetho dze dza tshimbila zwavhuḓi nga mulalo nga ḽa 9 Ṱhangule.

src_text: Condolences   Cabinet expressed condolences to the families and friends of:  the 18 schoolchildren and two adults who died in horrific accident in Pongola, KwaZulu-Natal on Friday, 16 September 2022 after an articulated truck collided head-on with bakkie transporting the learners  Appointments.
tgt_text: Muthusa Phresidennde Vho David Mabuza vho dzhenela vhuṱambo uvhu ha vhewa tshiduloni vho imela Phresidennde Vho Ramaphosa khathihi na muvhuso na vhathu vha Riphabuḽiki ya Afrika Tshipembe.

src_text: All appointments are subject to the verification of qualifications and the relevant clearance  Mr Makgothi Samuel Thobakgale as Director-General (DG): National Commissioner of the Department of Correctional Services  Dr Malixole Percival Mahlati as Deputy DG: Hospitals Tertiary Health Services and Human Resources Development at the Department of Health  Mr Siyabonga Blessing Mdubeki as Chief Surveyor-General at the Department of Agriculture, Land Reform and Rural Development  Mr Phaswa Phineas Mamogale as Chief Financial Officer at the Department of Health..
tgt_text: Vha Mbumbano ya Ragibii ya Afrika Tshipembe na vha Ḓorobo khulwane ya Kapa nge vha kona tshimbidza thonamennde ya vhumalo ya mitambo ya Rugby World Cup Sevens nga nḓila yavhuḓi vhukati ha ḽa 9 na 11 Khubvumedzi.

src_text: Cabinet concurred with the following appointments  Mr Tshediso Matona as Commissioner of the Broad-Based Black Economic Empowerment Commission  Members of the Appeal Tribunal of the Film and Publication Board: Mr Siyazi Tyamtyam (Chairperson); Ms Sohani Natasha Chundhur;Ms Sisanda Nkoala;Ms Shandukani Mulaudzi;Ms Nomaswazi Rachel Shabangu-Mndawe;Dr Litheko Modisane;Mr Phuti Nehemia Phukubje;Mr James Shikwambana; andMs Manko Thalitha Bufffel (reappointment).
tgt_text: Holwu lwo vha lwa tou thoma musi vhuṱambo uvhu ha maimo nṱha ngaurali vhu tshi tsimbidzwa nga shango ḽa Afrika nahone vhunzhi ha vhaṱaleli vha zwigidi na zwigidi vhe vha dzhenela vhuṱambo uvhu vho ḓiphina nga mitambo yo fhambanaho ya ragibii khathihi na vhuthu ha shango ḽashu ḽa Afrika Tshipembe vhu ḓivheaho ḽifhasini..     Maipfi ndiliso      Khabinethe yo ṱahisa maipfi ayo ndiliso kha vha miṱa na dzikhonani dza: Vhana vha tshikolo vha linganaho 18 na vhaaluwa vhavhili vhe vha lovha kha khombo shushaho ngei Pongola, kha ḽa KwaZulu-Natal nga Ḽavhuṱanu, ḽa 16 Khubvumedzi 2022 nga murahu ha musi ṱhiraka ḽa dekudeku ḽi tshi thulana nga tsha phanḓa na kugoloi kwa luṱanḓala kwe kwa vha ku tshi khou endedza vhagudi  tholwa tholwa hoṱhe hu ḓo khunyeledzwa nga murahu ha khwaṱhisedzwa ha ndalukano khathihi na ṱanzwa madzina ho teaho     Vho Makgothi Samuel Thobakgale sa Mulangi Muhulu (DG): Mukhomishinari wa Lushaka wa Muhasho wa Tshumelo dza Vhululamisi     Dokotela Vho Malixole Percival Mahlati sa Muthusa Mulangi Muhulu: Tshumelo dza Zwibadela na Mutakalo wa Nṱha na Mveledziso ya Vhashumi kha Muhasho wa Mutakalo     Vho Siyabonga Blessing Mdubeki sa Musedzulusi Muhulwane kha Muhasho wa Vhulimi, Mbuedzedzo ya Mavu na Mveledziso ya Vhupo ha Mahayani     Vho Phaswa Phineas Mamogale sa Muofisiri Muhulwane wa zwa Masheleni kha Muhasho wa Mutakalo..     Khabinethe yo tendelana na tholwa ha vhathu vha tevhelaho     Vho Tshediso Matona sa Mukhomishinari wa Khomishini ya zwa Maanḓafhadzwa ho Angalalaho ha Vharema siani ḽa Ikonomi     Miraḓo ya Khoro ya Khaṱhululo ya Bodo ya Matambwa na Nyanḓadzo: Vho Siyazi Tyamtyam (Mudzulatshidulo)Mufumakadzi Vho Sohani Natasha Chundhur;Mufumakadzi Vho Sisanda Nkoala;Mufumakadzi Vho Shandukani Mulaudzi;Mufumakadzi Vho Nomaswazi Rachel Shabangu-Mndawe;Dokotela Vho Litheko Modisane;Vho Phuti Nehemia Phukubje; Vho James Shikwambana; naMufumakadzi Vho Manko Thalitha Bufffel (vhane vha khou tou dovha hafhu tholwa).

src_text: Issues in the environment.
tgt_text: Nḓisedzo ya maḓi.

src_text: Water security.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo livhuwa vhadzulapo vha Afrika Tshipembe kha tevhedza havho nyiledzo dza kushumisele kwa maḓi dze dza vha hone kha vhuṅwe vhupo ha ḓorobo ya Johannesburg, Tshwane na Ekurhuleni itela dzikisa tshikalo tsha maḓi madamuni.

src_text: Cabinet thanked South Africans for adhering to water restrictions implemented in certain parts of Johannesburg, Tshwane and Ekurhuleni to stabilise the capacity of reservoirs.
tgt_text: Madamu na fhethu ha vhulungela hone maḓi zwi kha ḓi vha fhasi ha mutsiko nga mulandu wa thempheretsha dzi re nṱhesa kha vunḓu ḽa Gauteng ngeno ṱhoḓea ya maḓi ine ya khou dzulela engedzea yo kombetshedza uri vha ha Rand Water vha fhungudze vhukuma nḓisedzo ya maḓi kha mimasipala.

src_text: Dams and reservoirs remain under pressure due to high temperatures in Gauteng, and increasing demand forced Rand Water to reduce water supply to municipalities drastically.
tgt_text: Itshi tshiimiswa tsha zwa maḓi tshi ṋetshedza vhunzhi ha maḓi kunaho kha vhathu vha fhiraho 11 miḽioni vhane vha vha vhadzulapo vha vunḓu ḽa Gauteng, zwipiḓa zwa vunḓu ḽa Mpumalanga, Free State na ḽa Devhula Vhukovhela.

src_text: The water utility supplies bulk potable water to more than 11 million people in Gauteng, parts of Mpumalanga, the Free State and North West.
tgt_text: Hedzi nyiledzo dze dza vha dzi sa tinyei, dzo livhiswa kha ita uri hu vhe na nḓisedzo yavhuḓi ya maḓi nahone dzi ḓo bvela phanḓa vhuya swikela tshiimo tshi tshi khwinifhadzea.

src_text: These unavoidable restrictions aim to secure water supply and will remain in place until the situation improves.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ita khuwelelo kha miraḓo ya tshitshavha uri vha bvele phanḓa na tevhedza nyiledzo dza maḓi khathihi na shela mulenzhe nga shumisa hetshi tshiko tshi konḓaho wanala ngaurali nga nḓila yavhuḓi.

src_text: Cabinet called on the public to continue adhering to the water restrictions and play their part by using this scarce resource sparingly.
tgt_text: Tshiṱereke tsha fhaḽa Transnet.

src_text: Transnet strike.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza thendelano ya zwa miholo ya miṅwaha miraru ye ya swikelwa vhukati ha vha ha Transnet na vha Mbumbano ya Vhuthihi ha zwa Vhuendi ya Lushaka (UNTU), ḽine ḽa vha dzangano ḽa vhashumi, ine thendelano yeneyo ya ḓo thoma shuma vhukati ha tshifhinga tsha bva nga ḽa 1 Lambamai 2022 swika ḽa 31 Ṱhafamuhwe.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the three-year wage deal reached between Transnet and the United National Transport Union (UNTU), which is applicable for the period 1 April 2022 to 31 March.
tgt_text: Vha Khomishini ya Vhupfumedzani, Vhuṋenḓila na Vhulamukanyi ndi vhone vho swikelaho vhupfumedzani ha miholo iyi, zwe zwa fhedza nga fhelisa tshiṱereke tshine tsha vha hone zwazwino tsha miraḓo ya UNTU nga ṱavhanya.

src_text: The Commission for Conciliation, Mediation and Arbitration mediated this deal, which ended the current industrial action by members of UNTU with immediate effect.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo dovha hafhu ya ṱanganedza tsheo nga vha Dzangano ḽa Vhashumi vha zwa Vhuendi na Sekhithara dzi Elanaho ḽa Afrika Tshipembe (SATAWU) ya fhelisa tshiṱereke.

src_text: Cabinet also welcomed the decision by the South African Transport and Allied Workers Union to call off the strike.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo dovha hafhu ya ṱanganedza vhuḓiimiseli ha vha Transnet ha sedzesa kha fhungudza mishumo yo salelaho murahu ye ya vha hone kha sisteme yoṱhe ya vhuimangalavha na zwiporo nga tshifhinga tshenetsho tsha tshiṱereke tshe tsha kwama ikonomi khathihi na dziṅwe sekhithara dzine dzo ḓitika kha tshumelo yayo nga nḓila ine ya si vhe yavhuḓi..   Khabinethe yo livhuwa thikhedzo na tshumisano ye ya ṋetshedzwa nga vha mabindu nga tshifhinga tshenetshi tsha tshiṱereke.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the commitment by Transnet to focus on clearing backlogs that occurred across the port and rail system during the industrial action, which negatively impacted the economy and sectors that are dependent on its services..
tgt_text: Yo dovha hafhu ya ṱuṱuwedza vhushaka vhune ha khou bvela phanḓa vhukati ha vha ndangulo ya Transnet na madzangano vhashumi vhune ha ḓo vhuedza khamphani yeneyi ya Transnet khathihi na ikonomi ya shango.

src_text: Cabinet expressed its gratitude to the support and cooperation given by business during the strike.
tgt_text: Vhushaka vhukati ha shango ḽa Afrika Tshipembe na ḽa Saudi Arabia.

src_text: It encourages continuous relationship between Transnet management and labour for the benefit of the company and the economy of the country.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza Madalo u Shuma a tshimbila zwavhuḓi nga Phresidennde Vho Cyril Ramaphosa ngei kha shango ḽa Saudi Arabia nga ḽa 15 na ḽa 16 Tshimedzi.

src_text: South Africa – Saudi Arabia relations.
tgt_text: Nga tshifhinga tsha madalo aya, mashango aya vhuvhili hao saina Memorandamu dza Thendelano (MoUs) ya 17 kha masia fhambanaho fanaho na zwa vhulimi, vhufuwakhovhe, migodi, fulufulu ḽi vusuluseaho, vhutsireledzi, vhuendi na vhufuwivhulimi ha zwifuwo na zwimela zwa maḓini.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the successful Working Visit to the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia by President Cyril Ramaphosa on 15 and 16 October.
tgt_text: Dziṅwe MoU dze dza sainwa ndi dza thomiwa ha Khoro ya zwa Mabindu yo Ṱanganelaho, tshumisano kha sia ḽa nḓowetshumo dza zwa mmbi na zwa renga thundu na tshumelo khathihi na tshumisano kha sia ḽa ṱhoḓisiso dza zwa tshivhumbeo tsha shango.

src_text: During the visit, the two countries signed 17 Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) in various fields such as agriculture, fisheries, mining, renewable energy, security, transport and aquaculture.
tgt_text: Phresidennde vho shumisa madalo avho kha ramba vhoramabindu vha shango ḽa Saudi Arabia uri vha dzhenele muṱangano wa zwa vhubindudzi wa vhuṱanu wa shango ḽa Afrika Tshipembe une wa ḓo farwa nga ṅwaha wa.

src_text: Other MoUs signed are on the establishment of Joint Business Council, cooperation in the field of military industries and procurements, and on geological survey cooperation.
tgt_text: Shango ḽa Saudi Arabia ndi muvhambadzelani na ḽa Afrika Tshipembe wa vhuvhili nga vhuhulwane kha mashango oṱhe Vhubvaḓuvhakati ḽa dovha hafhu ḽa vha ḽone tshiko tshihulwanesa tsha thundu dzi ṱunḓwaho kha dzingu ḽoṱhe.

src_text: The President used the visit to invite Saudi Arabia businesses to South Africa’s fifth investment conference that will be held in.
tgt_text: Vhushaka ha dzitshaka vhukati ha mashango aya mavhili ho itisa uri hu vhe na masiandaitwa avhuḓi kha maitele zwa mbambadzo na vhubindudzi.

src_text: Saudi Arabia is South Africa’s second largest trading partner in the Middle East and the largest source of imports from the region.
International relations between both countries have resulted in positive effect on trade and investment trends.
tgt_text: Vhubindudzi kha zwa themamveledziso.

src_text: Infrastructure investment.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza thendelo ya thomiwa ha ḽimaga ḽa maimo nṱha ḽa bveledza puḽasitiki nga vhamagi vha puḽasitiki vha ḓivheaho ḽifhasini vha ḓivhiwaho sa ALPLA Group, fhaḽa Lanseria kha ḽa Gauteng.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the commissioning of state-of-the-art plastics production plant by leading international manufacturer, the ALPLA Group, at Lanseria in Gauteng.
tgt_text: Hezwi zwo engedza vhuḓiimiseli ha Phresidennde Vho Ramaphosa ha vhea zwa mveledziso ya themamveledziso sa tshone tshithu tshi ṱuṱuwedzaho ikonomi khathihi na engedza sikwa ha mishumo..   Uvhu vhubindudzi vhu linganaho US$50 miḽioni vhu ḓo shela mulenzhe zwihulwane kha pulane khulwane ya Lanseria Smart City ine ya ḓo ita uri zwithu zwi tshimbile nga nḓila yavhuḓi nahone lwa tshifhinga tshilapfu khathihi na vusulusa hafhu zwithu zwo no shumaho hu tshi katelwa na sika mishumo ya tshifhinga tshilapfu Iinganaho.

src_text: This augments President Ramaphosa’s commitment to position infrastructure development as means to stimulate the economy and increase employment..
tgt_text: Nga ngomu henefho ho katelwa na mbekanyamushumo ya vhugudisamishumo kha vhainzhiniere vha zwa thekiniki na lugisa vha linganaho 36 khathihi na vhorathekiniki vha zwa vusulusa hafhu zwithu zwo no shumaho ya mishumo ya vha khamphani ya ALPLA Group mona na mashango tshipembe ha Afrika.

src_text: The investment worth US$50 million is key contribution to the Lanseria Smart City masterplan that will drive sustainability and recycling as well as create and sustain 350 jobs.
tgt_text: Mbekanyamushumo ya zwa vhugudisamushumo ḓo thoma nga ṅwaha wa 2023, hune vhagudi vha mishumo vha thoma vha Afrika Tshipembe vha linganaho 12 vha ḓo vha vha tshi bva kha zwitshavha zwapo..   Zwa migodi siho mulayoni.

src_text: Included is an apprenticeship programme for 36 mechatronics and recycling technicians for ALPLA Group operations across southern Africa.
tgt_text: Zwa migodo siho mulayoni zwi vhaisa zwitshavha khathihi na ikonomi, nahone zwi fhedza nga ita uri hu vhe na ndozwo ya mbuelo kha muvhuso khathihi na kha sekhithara ya zwa migodi..   Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza zwa dzhiiwa ha muvhuli wa zwiṱhavhane khathihi na fariwa ha vhahumbulelwa vha swikaho 20 vhane vha ṱumanywa na zwiito zwa bwa migodi zwi siho mulayoni nga tshifhinga tsha fulo ḽe ḽa vha hone kha mulonga wa mugodi wa fhaḽa Stilfontein vunḓuni ḽa Devhula Vhukovhela.

src_text: The apprentice programme will commence in 2023, with the first 12 South African apprentices coming from local communities.
tgt_text: Khabinethe khou ita khuwelelo kha vhadzulapo vha Afrika Tshipembe ya uri vha bvele phanḓa na shumisana na vha mazhendedzi zwa mulayo itela vhona uri hu vhe na mvelaphanḓa kha mafulo u lwa na zwiito zwa vhugevhenga ḓaho.

src_text: Illegal mining.
tgt_text: Hezwi zwi ḓo rumela mulaedza wo khwaṱhaho wa uri vhugevhenga nangoho vhu badeli, khathihi na uri zwigevhenga zwi ḓo farwa nahone zwa dovha zwa sengiswa hu si na nyofho kana dzhia sia..   Fulufulu.

src_text: Illegal mining hurts communities and our economy, and results in loss of revenue for both government and the mining sector..
tgt_text: Eskom kha ḓi tou bva saina thendelano dza ḽisi ya miṅwaha ya 30 na vhabindudzi vha mveledziso ya muḓagasi vho ḓiimisaho nga vhoṱhe vha swikaho vhaṋa dza fhaṱa fhethu huswa ha bveledza fulufulu ḽo kunaho fhaḽa kha tshiṱitshi tsha Majuba na tsha Tutuka tshi re fhaḽa Mpumalanga.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the seizure of firearms cache and the arrest of 20 suspects linked to illegal mining during an operation at mineshaft in Stilfontein in North West.
tgt_text: Hedzi ḽisi dza mavu dzi ḓo kunga vhubindudzi vhune ha khou humbulelwa ḓo swika henefha kha R40 biḽioni.

src_text: Cabinet appeals to South Africans to continue working with law-enforcement agencies to ensure the success of future anti-crime operations.
tgt_text: Avha vhabindudzi vhaṋa, vhane vha vha vha ha HDF Energy South Africa, Red Rocket SA, Sola Group na Mainstream Renewable Power Developments South Africa, vha ḓo engedza 2 000 megawatts kha sisteme ya muḓagasi ya lushaka.

src_text: This will send strong message that crime does not pay, and that criminals will be arrested and prosecuted without fear or favour..   Energy.
tgt_text: Uvhu vhukoni vhuswa ha bveledza muḓagasi vhu khou lavhelelwa uri vhu ḓo ṱumanywa na sisteme ya nḓisedzo ya muḓagasi kha tshifhinga tsha vhukati ha miṅwedzi ya 24 ya kha ya 36 bva musi ho no tevhedzwa milayo yoṱhe ya zwa thendelano dza zwa masheleni khathihi na dziṅwe thendelano dza zwa milayo ya nga ha mupo, kukhethekanyelwe kwa mavu ya nga kushumisele kwao na miṅwe milayo yo teaho.

src_text: Eskom recently signed 30-year lease agreements with four independent power producer investors to construct new clean-energy generation capacity at Majuba and Tutuka power stations in Mpumalanga.
The land leases will attract an estimated investment of about R40 billion.
tgt_text: Mveledziso ya zwiḽiwa.

src_text: The four investors – HDF Energy South Africa, Red Rocket SA, Sola Group and Mainstream Renewable Power Developments South Africa – will contribute at least 2 000 megawatts to the national electricity grid.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza farwa ha Guvhangano ḽa vha ha Agri SA ḽa ṅwaha wa 2022 ngei ḓoroboni ya Pretoria nga ḽa 13 na ḽa 14 Tshimedzi 2022 nga fhasi ha thero ine ya ri: “U lima fhano hayani”.

src_text: The new generation capacity is expected to be connected to the grid within 24 to 36 months from financial closure, subject to environmental, land zoning and other regulatory approvals.
tgt_text: Guvhangano iḽi ḽo amba nga ha mafhungo fanaho na ita uri pulane khulwane dza zwa vhulimi dzi thome shumela vhalimi vha fhano hayani; themamveledziso ya tshifhinga tshilapfu hu tshi itelwa zwiḽiwa zwo liṅwaho fhano hayani ita uri vhupo honoho ha fhethu afho vhu tsireledzee lwa tshifhinga tshilapfu hu tshi itelwa mveledziso ya zwiḽiwa yapo yo livhaho kha vhumatshelo khathihi na khwaṱhisa vhukoni ha vhabveledzi vha zwiḽiwa ha shandukisa zwibveledzwa zwa vhulimi zwo ṱavhiwaho fhano hayani..   Sa nḓila ya dovha hafhu dzhiela nṱha mveledziso ya zwiḽiwa, Khabinethe yo dovha hafhu ya ṱanganedza thomiwa ha Senthara ya Mveledziso ya Zwibveledzwa zwa Vhulimi ya Lushaka nga kha Mbekanyamushumo ya Vhushaka ha Tshandukiso ya Zwibveledzwa zwa Vhulimi ya Muhasho wa Saentsi na Tshandukiso vha tshi shumisana na vha Yunivesithi ya Pretoria.

src_text: Food security.
tgt_text: Senthara iyi ḓo tikedza zwa thivhelwa fhungudzwa na ndangulo ya malwadze zwiliṅwa na zwifuwo, zwine hezwi zwa ḓo shela mulenzhe kha engedzea ha mveledziso, vhubveledzi ha zwiḽiwa khathihi na mveledziso ya vhupo ha mahayani ine ya nga vha ya tshifhinga tshilapfu   Tsheo dza Khabinethe.

src_text: Cabinet welcomed the hosting of the Agri SA Congress 2022 in Pretoria on 13 and 14 October 2022 under the theme: “Growing Local”.
tgt_text: Tsaino ya Thendelanomviswa ya Phaḓaladzo ya Mbumbano ya Afrika (AU).

src_text: The congress engaged on issues such as making agriculture masterplans work for local growers; sustainable infrastructure for locally grown food; making the local environment sustainable for local food production into the future, and strengthening food producers’ capacity to process locally grown produce.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza zwa ṋetshedzwa kha Phaḽamennde ha Thendelanomviswa ya AU ya nga ha Milayo na Maitele Phaḓaladzo, Muvhuso Wapo na Mveledziso Yapo uri sainiwe.

src_text: In further prioritising food security, Cabinet also welcomed the launch of the National Biosecurity Hub, by the Department of Science and Innovation's Agricultural Bio-economy Innovation Partnership Programme, in collaboration with the University of Pretoria.
tgt_text: Afrika Tshipembe ḽo saina iyi thendelanomviswa nga ṅwedzi wa Ṱhangule.

src_text: The hub will support the prevention, reduction and management of crop and animal disease, which will contribute to increased productivity, food security and sustainable rural development   Cabinet decisions.
Ratification of the Decentralisation Charter of the African Union (AU).
tgt_text: Thendelanomviswa ya Phaḓaladzo ṋetshedza muhanga kha mashango oṱhe ane vha miraḓo une wa vha ḽiṅwalo ḽi sumbedzaho nḓila nga ha phaḓaladzwa ha maanḓa na mishumo bva kha mivhuso ya vhukati ya kha maṅwe masia muvhuso.

src_text: Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament the AU Charter on the Values and Principles of Decentralisation, Local Governance and Local Development for ratification.
tgt_text: Iyi Thendelanomviswa ambesa nga maanḓa nga ha phaḓaladzwa ha maanḓa na vhuḓifhinduleli, muhanga wa mavhusele apo khathihi na mveledziso yapo..   Muṱangano wa vhu32 wa Khoro ya zwa Vhutsireledzi ha Zwiporo ya Dzitshaka (IRSC) wa ṅwaha nga ṅwaha.

src_text: South Africa signed the charter in August..
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza farwa ha Muṱangano wa vhu32 wa IRSC wa Ṅwaha nga Ṅwaha ngei Johannesburg bva nga ḽa 1 swika ḽa 6 Tshimedzi 2023 nga fhasi ha thero ine ya ri: “U fhaṱa hafhu zwiporo nga huswa kha Ḽifhasi ḽi sa fulufhedzisi”.

src_text: The Decentralisation Charter provides framework to all member states guiding document on the decentralisation of powers and functions from national to other spheres of government.
tgt_text: IRSC ndi muṱangano wa dzitshaka une wa kuvhanganya vhaḓivhi vha zwa vhutsireledzi ha zwiporo bva kha ḽifhasi ḽoṱhe uri vha kovhane nḓivho hu tshi itelwa khwinifhadza vhutsireledzi kha zwiporo..   Sa muraḓo wa IRSC, vha Vhulangi ha Vhutsireledzi ha Zwiporo ha Afrika Tshipembe vho fara muṱangano uyu lwa fhedzisela nga ṅwaha wa.

src_text: The charter deals largely with the decentralisation of authority and functions, local governance framework and local development.
tgt_text: Luṱa lwa 2 lwa Mvetamveto ya Pulane ya Themamveledziso ya Lushaka ya 2050 (NIP 2050).

src_text: 32nd Annual International Railway Safety Council (IRSC).
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza zwa ganḓiswa kha gurannḓa ya muvhuso ha mvetamveto ya Luṱa lwa 2 lwa NIP 2050 hu tshi itelwa zwa vhukwamani na miraḓo ya tshitshavha.

src_text: Cabinet approved the hosting of the 32nd Annual IRSC Meeting in Johannesburg from 1 to 6 October 2023 under the theme: “Reshaping railways in an uncertain World”.
tgt_text: Pulane iyi sumbedzisa nḓila kha zwa khwaṱhiswa na engedzwa ha thandela dza muvhuso dzo ṱanganelaho nahone dza ndeme..   Lu dovha hafhu lwa ṱalusa thandela dza ndeme dza zwa vhudzulo ha vhathu; muḓagasi wa ha masipala; maḓi; mathukhwi omaho; vhuendi ha hwala vhaṋameli; themamveledziso ya pfunzo na mutakalo; themamveledziso ya didzhithala, vhugevhenga na zwiito zwa vhuaḓa.

src_text: The IRSC is an international forum that brings together railway safety professionals from all over the world to exchange experiences so as to improve railway safety..   As member of the IRSC, South Africa’s Railway Safety Regulator last hosted this forum in.
tgt_text: Tshivhumbeo tsha pulane tshi ṋetshedza bono ḽa masia ane khou tea lavheleswa khao, tsha dovha hafhu tsha ṋetshedza tsenguluso ya tshiimo tsha zwino, tsha bvisela khagala nyimele dza ndeme dzine dza ḓo ita uri hu vhe na shuma zwavhuḓi khathihi na sumbedzisa zwine zwa tea itwa itela swikela bono ḽeneḽo.

src_text: Draft National Infrastructure Plan 2050 (NIP 2050) Phase.
tgt_text: Tshi dovha hafhu tsha dzinginya maitele u thoma shumiswa ha pulane iyi ane ḓo itwa nga vhukati ha tshifhinga tsha miṅwaha miraru ya pulane ya kushumele..   Muhanga wa shuma wa Lushaka ho livhiwa kha ita uri Tshumelo dza Muvhuso dzi vhe dza Mishumogudwa.

src_text: Cabinet approved the gazetting of the draft NIP 2050 Phase 2 for public consultation.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza Muhanga wa thoma shuma ha Lushaka ho livhiwa kha ita uri Tshumelo dza Muvhuso dzi vhe dza Mishumogudwa.

src_text: The plan offers direction in strengthening and augmenting government strategic integrated projects..
tgt_text: Muhanga uyu wo anḓadzwa hu tshi itelwa uri hu vhe na vhukwamani nga ṅwaha wa.

src_text: It identifies the strategic projects in human settlements; municipal electricity; water; solid waste; passenger transport; education and health infrastructure; digital infrastructure, and crime and corruption.

The format of the plan provides vision of the area to be tackled, offers an assessment of the current status, outlines the essential conditions for success and states what needs to be done to achieve the vision.
tgt_text: Muhanga uyu dovha hafhu wa ṋetshedza thikho ṱhanu dza nga ha maga u ita uri Tshumelo dza Muvhuso dzi vhe dza mishumogudwa.

src_text: It proposes the implementation process to be taken over the three-year running cycle action plan.
tgt_text: Thikho idzi dzi katela maitele ane vha u ranga musi hu tshi ṱoḓa kungwa vhashumi khathihi na u nanga vhashumi vho teaho henefho kha Tshumelo dza Muvhuso pfumbudzwa na ṱanganyiswa na vhaṅwe vhashumi; ndangulo ya vhupulani na mashumele; vhugudi vhune ha khou bvela phanḓa, khathihi na mveledziso ya mishumogudwa hu tshi katelwa aluwa kha zwa mishumo khathihi na zwiwo zwa mishumo.

src_text: National Implementation Framework towards the Professionalisation of the Public Service.
tgt_text: Tshanduko kha nyimele dza kutholelwe kwa Vhalangi Vhahulwane (DGs).

src_text: Cabinet approved the National Implementation Framework towards the Professionalisation of the Public Service.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza muvhigo une wa khou dzinginya maga u khwaṱhisa vhukoni na zwikili zwa dziDG kha Tshumelo dza Muvhuso.

src_text: The framework was published for public consultation in.
tgt_text: Muvhigo wo ṋetshedza makumedzwa fhambanaho, hu tshi katelwa na themo ya shuma ya dziDG khathihi na ndangulo ya vhurumelwa nga vha Khorotshitumbe ya muvhuso kha vhaofisiri vho ṋewaho maanḓa..   Muvhigo uyu dovha hafhu wa dzinginya uri DG Ofisini ya Phresidennde ḓo ḓivhiwa sa Ṱhoho ya Ndangulo ya Muvhuso.
Kha mavunḓu, hoyu mushumo ḓo ṋetshedzwa kha dziDG kha ofisi dza Vhalangavunḓu.

src_text: The framework provides five pillars on interventions in professionalising the Public Service.
tgt_text: Muvhigo wo dovha hafhu wa dzinginya maga u eletshedza mihasho nga ha kulangelwe kwa khonṱhiraka dza dziDG.

src_text: The pillars include pre-entry recruitment and selection within the Public Service; induction and onboarding; planning and performance management; continuous learning and professional development, and career progression and career incidents.
tgt_text: Sisteme ya Ndangulo ya Mashumele dziDG yo senguluswaho khou dovha ya senguluswa hafhu nga huswa itela uri elane na tshanduko dzo tendelwaho.

src_text: Changes in the conditions of employment for Directors-General (DGs).
tgt_text: Minisṱa vha Tshumelo dza Muvhuso na Ndangulo vho tou Farelaho, Vho Thulas Nxesi, vha ḓo vhidza muṱangano wa vhoramafhungo vhege ḓaho une khawo vha ḓo bvisela khagala Muhanga wa shuma wa Lushaka wo livhiswaho kha ita uri Tshumelo dza Muvhuso dzi vhe dza Mishumogudwa khathihi na bvisela khagala tshanduko dzo tendelwaho dza nga ha nyimele dza shuma dza dziDG.

src_text: Cabinet approved the report that proposes measures to strengthen the capacity and capability of the DGs in the Public Service.
tgt_text: Muvhigo wa Vhuṱanu wa Mvelaphanḓa ya nga ha thoma shuma ha Nḓivhadzamulayotibe ya nga ha Pfanelo dza Vhathu vhane vha vha na Vhuholefhali (WPRPD) wa ṅwaha wa 2020-.

src_text: The report made several proposals,  including the tenure of DGs and the management of delegations by the Executive Authority to the accounting officers..
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza Muvhigo wa Vhuṱanu wa Mvelaphanḓa ya nga ha thoma shuma ha WPRPD, ine ya vha yone ṋetshedzaho maswamaswa nga ha thoma shuma ha WPRPD.

src_text: The report also proposed that the DG in The Presidency will be designated as the Head of Public Administration.
tgt_text: Muvhigo katela na vhupfiwa bva kha mihasho ya muvhuso wa lushaka na wa mavunḓu dovha hafhu wa bvisela khagala zwiswa nga ha thoma shuma ha mbekanyamaitele ine ya katela mikovho ya migaganyagwama..   Muvhigo wa thoma wa nga ha mvelaphanḓa wa ṅwaha nga ṅwaha wo anḓadzwa nga ṅwaha wa.

src_text: In the provinces, this function will be designated to the DGs in the offices of the Premiers.
tgt_text: Muvhigo wa vhuṱanu wa nga ha mvelaphanḓa wo ṱanganedzwa uri ḓo ḓivhadzwa kha gurannḓa ya muvhuso nahone wa dovha wa anḓadzwa nga vha Muhasho wa Vhafumakadzi, Vhaswa na Vhathu vha re na Vhuholefhali..   Khwiniso ya Tshiteṅwa tsha 20(1) tsha Thendelano dza nga ha fheliswa ha Zwiito zwoṱhe zwa Khethululo Itelwaho Vhafumakadzi (CEDAW).

src_text: The report further proposed measures to guide departments on the management of contracts of DGs.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza ṋetshedzwa ngomu Phalamenndeni ha khwiniso ya Tshiteṅwa tsha 20(1) tsha CEDAW itela uri sainiwe.

src_text: The revised Performance Management System for DGs is being revised to align it with the approved changes.
tgt_text: Khwiniso idzi dzi ṋetshedza tshikhala tsho engedzwaho tsha miṱangano ya komiti ine ya shuma na mivhigo ya mashango ane vha miraḓo.

src_text: The Acting Minister of Public Service and Administration, Mr Thulas Nxesi, will next week convene media briefing to outline the National Implementation Framework towards the Professionalisation of the Public Service and also unpack the approved changes in the conditions of employment for DGs.
tgt_text: Afrika Tshipembe ḽo saina hedzi thendelano nga ṅwaha wa 1993 he ḽa dovha ḽa tendelana nadzo nga ṅwedzi wa Nyendavhusiku.

src_text: Fifth Progress Report on the Implementation of the White Paper on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities (WPRPD) 2020-.
tgt_text: Uhu ṋetshedzwa hadzo Phalamenndeni ndi hune ha khou lingedza ṱumanya thendelano dze na dzone ha tendelanwa khadzo tshifhingani tsho fhelaho na khwiniso idzi dza Tshiteṅwa tsha 20(1) tsha thendelano.

src_text: Cabinet approved the Fifth Progress Report on the Implementation of the WPRPD, which provides an update on the implementation of the WPRPD.
tgt_text: Thendelano dza Ḽifhasi dza nga ha Ṱanganedzwa ha Ndalukano dza Pfunzo dza Nṱha .

src_text: The report covers inputs from national and provincial government departments.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza ṋetshedzwa ngomu Phalamenndeni ha Thendelano dza Ḽifhasi dza nga ha Ṱanganedzwa ha Ndalukano dza Pfunzo dza Nṱha itela uri hu vhe na tendelana.

src_text: It provides updates on the policy implementation that include budget allocations..
tgt_text: Musi ho no vha na tendelana khadzo, dzi ḓo rumelwa kha vha Khethekanyo ya zwa Pfunzo, Saintsi na Mvelele ya vha Dzangano ḽa Mbumbano ya Dzitshaka (UN) khathihi na ḓo ita uri ngeno hayani dzi shume nga kha Mulayo wa Muhanga wa Ndalukano wa Lushaka, wa ṅwaha wa 2008 (Mulayo 67 wa 2008).

src_text: The first annual progress report was published in.
tgt_text: Thendelano dza Ḽifhasi dzi bveledza milayo ya ḽifhasi ya ṱanganedzwa ha ndalukano dza pfunzo dza nṱha nga nḓila linganaho re khagala nahone si na khethululo.

src_text: This fifth progress report has been approved to be gazetted and published by the Department of Women, Youth and Persons with Disabilities.
tgt_text: Dzi dovha hafhu dza tendela hu tshi vha na ṱanganedzwa ha ndalukano dza mashango nnḓa kha mashango ane vha miraḓo ya UN swikaho humiselwa murahu ha khwiniso dza Tsumbamaitele dza Miraḓo ya Khabinethe.

src_text: Amendment to Article 20(1) of the Convention on the Elimination of All Forms of Discrimination Against Women (CEDAW).
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo khwaṱhisedza nḓivhadzo ye ya ḓo itwa nga Ofisi ya Phresidennde nga Musumbuluwo, wa ḽa 17 Tshimedzi 2022 ya humisela murahu ha khwiniso dze dza itwa kha Tsumbamaitele ya Miraḓo ya Khabinethe, ine ya dovha hafhu ya ḓivhiwa sa Bugupfarwa ya Dziminisṱa, ya ṅwaha wa..   Khwiniso hedzi dze dza ḓo itwa nga ṅwedzi wa Lambamai 2022 dzi ṋetshedza tshikhala tsha engedza vhaṅwe vhashumi kha dziṅwe dza dziofisi dza Dziminisṱa vhane vha vha na vhuḓifhinduleli ha muhasho fhiraho muthihi.

src_text: Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the amendment to Article 20(1) of the CEDAW for ratification.
tgt_text: Dzi dovha hafhu dza lavhelela uri Muvhuso dzhie vhuḓifhinduleli ho fhelelaho ha zwa masheleni ane elana na ṋetshedzwa ha maḓi na muḓagasi kha madzulo tshiofisi ane avho miraḓo ya khabinethe vha dzula khao..     Khabinethe yo dzhiela nṱha sa farea zwavhuḓi ha vhadzulapo he ya fhedza nga dzhia tsheo ya dovha shandukisa hafhu iyo Tsumbamaitele ya Miraḓo ya Khabinethe.

src_text: The amendments provide for an increased duration of the committee meetings that process the member states’ reports.
tgt_text: Haya maitele ḓo tshimbidzwa nga tshiimiswa tsho imaho nga tshoṱhe nahone musi tshi tou khunyeledzwa, iyo tsumbamaitele ya hone vho ḓo wanala na kha webusaithi ya Muhasho wa Tshumelo dza Muvhuso na Ndangulo ine ya vha: www.dpsa.gov.za.

src_text: South Africa signed this convention in 1993 and subsequently ratified it in December.
tgt_text: Vhushaka ha Shandukela kha Fulufulu ḽi Pfadzaho (JETP) na Pulane ya Vhubindudzi kha JETP (JETP-IP).

src_text: The submission to Parliament seeks to align the previously ratified convention with the amendment to Article 20(1) of the convention.
tgt_text: Nga murahu ha ṱanganedza makumedzwa nga ha JETP na JETP-IP, Khabinethe yo khwaṱhisedza JETP-IP ya dovha hafhu ya sumbedzisa takalela mushumo nga vhuḓalo we wa itwa hu tshi itelwa i bveledza..   JETP-IP bvisela khagala vhubindudzi vhune ha ṱoḓea itela swikela vhuḓikumedzeli ha fhelisa zwa muhasaladzo wa khaboni he ha itwa nga Muvhuso wa ḽa Afrika Tshipembe musi tshi khou ṱuṱuwedza mveledziso ya tshifhinga tshilapfu khathihi na vhona uri hu khou vha na tshanduko pfadzaho kha vhashumi na zwitshavha zwi kwameaho.

src_text: Global Convention on the Recognition of Qualifications concerning Higher Education .
Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the Global Convention on the Recognition of Qualifications concerning Higher Education for ratification.
tgt_text: Komiti ya Vhukati ha Dziminisṱa ya nga ha Tshanduko ya Kilima ḓo fara muṱangano na vhoramafhungo hu si kale itela uri ṋetshedze zwidodombedzwa nga vhuḓalo   Milayotibe.

src_text: Once ratified it will be deposited to the United Nations (UN) Educational, Scientific and Cultural Organization and domestically enabled through the National Qualifications Framework Act, 2008 (Act 67 of 2008).
tgt_text: Mulayotibe wa Zwikepe zwa Vhavhambadzi wa ṅwaha wa.

src_text: The Global Convention establishes universal principles for fair, transparent and non-discriminatory recognition of higher education qualifications and qualifications.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza ṋetshedzwa ha Mulayotibe wa Zwikepe zwa Vhavhambadzi wa ṅwaha wa 2022 ngei Phalamenndeni hu tshi itelwa uri kone davhidzaniwa nga hawo ya phanḓa.

src_text: It allows for the recognition of foreign qualifications in 193 UN member states.
tgt_text: Mulayotibe uyu vusulusa uyo muṅwe Mulayo wa Zwikepe zwa Vhavhambadzi, wa ṅwaha wa 1951 (Mulayo 57 wa 1951) une wa vha na miṅwaha ya..   Musi wo no phasiswa, Mulayotibe uyu ḓo ṋetshedza muhanga wa zwa milayo wa zwikepe zwa vhavhambadzi une wa ḓo shuma kha langa zwa engedza ndeme kha zwikepe ḓo dovha hafhu wa langa zwa olwa redzhisiṱara rinwa madzina na bviswa ha zwikepe nḓilani.

src_text: Withdrawal of the amendments to the Guide for Members of the Executive.
tgt_text: Hedzi tshanduko dzi ḓo shela mulenzhe kha vusuluswa ha sekhithara ya vhuendi ha zwa lwanzheni khathihi na ita uri hu vhe na elana kha kutshimbidzele kwa zwa lwanzheni vhukati ha shango ḽino na Thendelano dza Dzangano ḽa zwa Lwanzheni ḽa Dzitshaka.

src_text: Cabinet endorsed the announcement made by The Presidency on Monday, 17 October 2022 to withdraw the amendments made to the Guide for Members of the Executive, also called the Ministerial Handbook, for..
tgt_text: Afrika Tshipembe ḽo saina thendelano idzi.

src_text: The amendments that were made in April 2022 provided for additional capacity to some of the offices of the Ministers who are responsible for more than one portfolio.
They also required the State to take over full responsibility for the costs associated with the provision of electricity and water to official residences occupied by members of the executive..
tgt_text: Mulayotibe wa Khwiniso ya zwa Mbalombalo wa ṅwaha wa.

src_text: Cabinet noted the concerns raised by the public and resolved to review the Guide for Members of the Executive.
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo ṱanganedza ṋetshedzwa ngomu Phalamenndeni ha Mulayotibe wa Khwiniso ya zwa Mbalombalo wa ṅwaha wa 2022 hu tshi itelwa uri hu vhe na davhidzaniwa nga hawo.

src_text: This process will be handled by neutral structure and once completed, the guide will be made public through the Department of Public Service and Administration’s website: www.dpsa.gov.za.
tgt_text: Mulayotibe uyu dzinginya uri hu vhe na khwiniso kha Mulayo wa zwa Mbalombalo, wa ṅwaha wa 1999 (Mulayo 6 wa 1999).

src_text: Just Energy Transition Partnership (JETP) and JETP Investment Plan (JETP-IP).
tgt_text: Khwiniso idzi dzi ṋetshedza tshikhala tsha bveledzwa na thoma shumiswa ha Sisteme ya zwa Mbalombalo ya Lushaka ine ya tikedza tsheo dzo ḓitikaho nga vhuṱanzi..   Dzi khwaṱhisa tshumisano ine ya vha hone zwazwino vhukati ha vha Mbalombalo dza Afrika Tshipembe na zwiṅwe zwiimiswa zwa muvhuso khathihi na engedza muhanga wa zwa milayo kha Mulayo   Vhuṱambo vhune ha khou ḓa.

src_text: After welcoming presentation on the JETP and the JETP-IP, Cabinet endorsed the JETP-IP and expressed its appreciation of the detailed work undertaken to develop it..
tgt_text: Muṱangano wa Lushaka wa Phresidennde wa nga ha Mabindu Maṱuku, Maṱukuṱuku na Vhukati (SMME) na Dzikoporasi.

src_text: The JETP-IP outlines the investments required to achieve the decarbonisation commitments made by the Government of South Africa while promoting sustainable development, and ensuring just transition for affected workers and communities..
tgt_text: Muhasho wa Mveledziso ya Mabindu Maṱuku, nga tshumisano na vhashumisani vha kha sekhithara ya phuraivethe ḓo fara Muṱangano wa Lushaka wa Phresidennde wa nga ha dziSMME na Dzikoporasi fhaḽa Bryanston, kha vunḓu ḽa Gauteng bva nga ḽa 13 swika ḽa 15 Lara..   Muṱangano uyu ḓo kuvhanganya fhethu huthihi vhashumisani kha sekhithara ya phuraivethe na ya muvhuso kha nḓowetshumo ya mabindu maṱuku uri vha ambe nga ha wana nḓila dza shumisana kha khwaṱhisa sekhithara iyi.

src_text: The Inter-Ministerial Committee on Climate Change will soon hold media briefing to provide more details   Bills.
tgt_text: Zwiimiswa zwine zwa khou lavhelelwa shela mulenzhe zwi katela madzangano zwa makwevho, vhashumi vha kha dziSMME, vhoradzipfunzo, vhaiti vha mbekanyamaitele na zwiimiswa zwa masheleni mveledziso.

src_text: Merchant Shipping Bill of.
tgt_text: Muṱangano uyu ḓo dovha hafhu wa amba nga ha Pulane khulwane ya Lushaka yo Ṱanganelaho ya nga ha Mveledziso ya Mabindu Maṱuku, ine ya ṋetshedza muhanga wa ndeme wa khwaṱhisa sekhithara ya SMME.

src_text: Cabinet has approved the submission of the Merchant Shipping Bill of 2022 to Parliament for further processing.
tgt_text: Muṱangano uyu khou dovha hafhu wa lavhelelwa thoma na Pfufho dza Phresidennde dza nga ha dziSMME dza Lushaka dza Ṅwaha nga Ṅwaha farwa ha Muṱangano wa Phresidennde wa nga ha Khakhathi dzo Ḓitikaho nga Mbeu na Mabulayo Vhafumakadzi (GBVF) wa ṅwaha wa.

src_text: The Bill overhauls the 70-year-old Merchant Shipping Act, 1951 (Act 57 of 1951).
tgt_text: Phresidennde Vho Ramaphosa vha ḓo fara Muṱangano wa Phresidennde wa nga ha zwiito zwa GBVF wa vhuvhili fhaḽa Gallagher Convention Centre kha ḽa Gauteng nga ḽa 1 na ḽa 2 Lara.

src_text: Once enacted, the Bill will provide the merchant shipping legal framework to regulate ships’ value chain.
tgt_text: Muṱangano wa thoma we wa farwa nga ṅwaha wa 2018 wo shumiswa kha kumedza hafhu muvhuso na vhashumisani vha zwa matshilisano kha fhelisa zwiwo zwo andesaho zwa khakhathi dzi itelwaho vhafumakadzi kha ḽino shango.

src_text: It will regulate amongst others the designing, registration, naming and scrapping of ships.
These changes will contribute towards reviving the maritime transport sector and also aligning the country with the International Maritime Organisation Convention.
tgt_text: Muṱangano wa vhuvhili ḓo shumiswa kha lavhelesa murahu kha mvelaphanḓa ye ya swikelwa kha zwa thoma shumiswa ha Pulane ya Ndeme ya Lushaka ya nga ha GBVF ḓo farwa nga fhasi ha thero ine ya ri: “Vhuḓifhinduleli ṱavhanyedza na ṱavha mukosi ZWINO”..   Muṱangano uyu ḓo dovha hafhu wa amba nga ha maṅwe mafhungo fanaho na wana nḓila dza ita uri zwoṱhe zwine zwa khou tea itwa zwi itwe nga tshihaḓu hu tshi katelwa na vhuḓifhinduleli bva kha mihasho ya ndeme khathihi na vhoṱhe vha kwameaho fana na madzangano zwitshavha, sekhithara dza phuraivethe na madzangano vhashumi.

src_text: South Africa has ratified this convention.

tgt_text: Imbizo ya Phresidennde ya Vhuṱanu ngei Northern Cape.

src_text: Statistics Amendment Bill of.
tgt_text: Imbizo ya Phresidennde ya Ḽiedza ḽa Mveledziso ya Tshiṱiriki ḽa Vhuṱanu (DDM) ngei Upington, kha vunḓu ḽa Northern Cape ḓo farwa nga Ḽavhuṱanu, ḽa 21 Tshimedzi 2022 fhaḽa Tshiṱediamu tshapo tsha Mxolisi Dicky Jacobs..    Imbizo ya Phresidennde ya nga ha DDM ḓo sengulusa mvelaphanḓa na khaedu kha zwa nḓisedzo ya tshumelo fhaḽa kha vunḓu ḽa Northern Cape khathihi na dzhenelela hu tshi itelwa dzi tandulula.

src_text: Cabinet approved the submission to Parliament of the Statistics Amendment Bill of 2022 for further processing.
tgt_text: DDM ḓo vhona uri vhupulani ha zwa nḓisedzo ya tshumelo, zwa thoma shuma na ita mugaganyagwama zwi khou ṱanganyiswa fhethu huthihi itela khwaṱhisa nḓisedzo ya tshumelo kha zwitshavha.

src_text: The Bill proposes the amendment to the Statistics Act, 1999 (Act 6 of 1999).
The amendments provide for the development and implementation of the National Statistics System that supports evidence-based decisions..
tgt_text: Musi tshifhinga tsha Imbizo tshi tshi khou sendela, Dziminisṱa, miraḓo ya khorotshitumbe na vhoṋeḓorobo vha ḓo thoma mafulo u kwamana na zwitshavha mona na vhupo ha Upington..   Tshitatamennde tsha Mbekanyamaitele ya Mugaganyagwama wa Vhukati ha Ṅwaha (MTBPS).

src_text: They strengthen the existing coordination between Statistics South Africa and other organs of state, and broaden the regulatory framework of the Act   Upcoming events.
tgt_text: Khabinethe tenda kha ḽa uri MTBPS ya ṅwaha wa 2022 ine ya khou ḓo ṋetshedzwa nga Minisṱa wa Gwama Vho Enoch Godongwana nga Ḽavhuraru, ḽa 26 Tshimedzi 2022 ndi tshipiḓa tsha ndeme tsha maitele u dzudzanya mugaganyagwama nga nḓila re khagala nahone ya vhuḓifhinduleli kha ḽa Afrika Tshipembe..   MTBPS ṋetshedza ṱhalutshedzo ya vhuḓiimiseli ha muvhuso kha zwa kushumisele kwa masheleni kune shango ḽa nga kona ku swikela dovha hafhu ya bvisela khagala nḓila ine muvhuso wa ḓo vala ngayo tshikhala vhukati ha mbuelo na kushumisele kwa masheleni khathihi na ita zwinzhi hu tshi shumiswa zwiko zwine zwa vha hone zwazwino.

src_text: National Presidential Small, Micro and Medium Enterprises (SMME) and Cooperatives Summit.

The Department of Small Business Development, in partnership with private-sector stakeholders, will host the National Presidential SMME and Cooperatives Summit in Bryanston, Gauteng from 13 to 15 November..
tgt_text: Milingo ya Maṱiriki.

src_text: The summit will bring together private and public sector key actors in the small enterprise ecosystem, to deliberate on finding ways to collaborate in strengthening this sector.
tgt_text: Milingo ya Lushaka ya Maṱiriki ya ṅwaha wa 2022 khou ḓo thoma nga ḽa 31 Tshimedzi ya fhela nga ḽa 7 Nyendavhusiku.

src_text: Expected participants include chambers of commerce, SMME practitioners, academics, policymakers and development finance institutions.
tgt_text: Khabinethe khou tamela mashudu vhagudi vha Kiḽasi ya ṅwaha wa 2022 zwenezwo musi vha tshi khou ḓo dzhena kha lwendo lwavho lwa fhedzisela lwa zwa tshikolo.

src_text: The summit will also discuss the National Integrated Small Enterprise Development Masterplan, which provides strategic framework to strengthen the SMME sector.
tgt_text: Thikhedzo ine ya khou bvela phanḓa bva kha vhadededzi, vhabebi na vhaunḓi ḓo ita zwinzhi kha thusa vhagudi uri vha kone thoma milingo iyi yavho vho ḓala fulufhelo..   Khabinethe khou eletshedza vhabebi na vhaunḓi uri vha shele mulenzhe nga ṱuṱuwedza na sumbedza nḓila vhagudi khathihi na bveledza nyimele yavhuḓi ya uri vha kone guda mahayani.

src_text: The summit is also expected to introduce the Annual National Presidential SMME Awards.
tgt_text: Muṱangano wa nga ha Pulane ya Mveledziso ya Lushaka (NDP) na Vhukoni ha Shango.

src_text: Hosting of the Presidential Gender-Based Violence and Femicide (GBVF) Summit.
tgt_text: Muhasho wa Tshumelo dza Muvhuso na Ndangulo tshi khou shumisana na vha Khomishini ya zwa Vhupulani ya Lushaka khathihi na vha Tshikolo tsha Ngudo dza nga ha Mveledziso tsha Yunivesithi ya KwaZulu-Natal ḓo fara Muṱangano wa nga ha NDP na Vhukoni ha Shango bva nga ḽa 7 swika ḽa 9 Ḽara 2022 fhaḽa Khamphasini ya Gudedzi ḽa Howard, hune ha vha Yunivesithi ya KwaZulu-Natal..   Muṱangano uyu ḓo sedzesa kha vhukoni ha shango khathihi na mashumele muvhuso kha miṅwaha ya 10 ya thoma ya NDP nahone ḓo farwa nga fhasi ha thero ine ya ri: “U lavhelesa kha Vhukoni ha Shango na Mashumele Muvhuso nga kha miṅwaha ya fumi ya thoma ya NDP” ṋetshedzwa ha Ṱhanziela ya Ṱanganedzwa kha Khosikhulu Vho Misuzulu ka Zwelithini.

src_text: President Ramaphosa will host the second Presidential GBVF Summit at the Gallagher Convention Centre in Gauteng on 1 and 2 November.
tgt_text: Phresidennde Vho Ramaphosa vha ḓo ṋetshedza Ṱhanziela ya Ṱanganedzwa kha Muhulisei Khosikhulu Vho Misuzulu KaZwelithini fhaḽa Tshiṱediamu tsha Moses Mabhida, ḓoroboni ya Durban nga Mugivhela, wa ḽa 29 Tshimedzi.

src_text: The first summit held in 2018 was used to recommit government and social partners to ending the high incidents of violence against women in the country..
The second summit will be used to take stock of the progress made in the implementation of the National Strategic Plan on GBVF.
tgt_text: Hezwi zwi khou ḓo vha hone nga murahu ha vhuṱambo ha sialala ha vhea vhuhosi vhune ha ḓivhiwa sa “Ukungena eSibayeni” ha Muhulisei Khosikhulu he ha farwa nga ḽa 20 Ṱhangule 2022, vhune ha vha hone vhuṱambo he ha ita uri vha dzhene tshiduloni tsha vha Khosikhulu ya Lushaka lwa MaZulu   Milaedza fhululedzaKhabinethe yo livhisa maipfi ayo u fhululedza na tamela mashudu kha: Vho Sam Matekane, Minisṱa Muhulwane ane kha ḓi tou bva khethiwa wa shango ḽa Lesotho.

src_text: It will be hosted under the theme: “Accountability; Acceleration and Amplification NOW”..
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo dovha hafhu ya vha luthihi na vha Vhurumelwa ha Vhulavhelesi ha zwa Dzikhetho ha vha dzangano ḽa AU musi tshi fhululedza Khetho dza Buthano ḽa Lushaka dza shango ḽa Lesotho dzo farwaho nga ḽa 7 Tshimedzi 2022 dze dza sumbedza aluwa ha vhathu vha shango iḽo siani ḽa zwa dzikhetho na polotiki nge vha tshimbidza khetho dzavho zwavhuḓi.

src_text: The summit will deliberate on, amongst other issues, finding ways to accelerate actions and accountability from key departments and all the stakeholders that include civil society, the private sector and labour..   Fifth Presidential Imbizo to the Northern Cape.
tgt_text: Afrika Tshipembe ḽi kha ḓi vha ḽo ḓiimisela kha khwaṱhisa na ṱanganya vhushaka ha mashango aya mavhili hu tshi katelwa na khwaṱhisa tshumisano kha mafhungo elanaho dzingu dzhango na ḽifhasi nga angaredza.

src_text: The Fifth District Development Model (DDM) Presidential Imbizo in Upington, Northern Cape will take place on Friday, 21 October 2022 at the local Mxolisi Dicky Jacobs Stadium..
tgt_text: Maipfi Ndiliso Khabinethe yo rumela maipfi ndiliso kha vha muṱa na dzikhonani dza: Vhafunzi Vho Albert Nolan (88), vhe vha vha vhe Mufunzi wa Kereke ya Khatholiki ya Afrika Tshipembe ḓiimiselaho we itela khaedu kuhumbulele kwa zwa vhurereli kwe kwa vha ku tshi ṱoḓa khwaṱhisedza sisteme ya zwa khethululo nga lukanda.

src_text: The DDM Presidential Imbizo will assess service-delivery progress and challenges in the Northern Cape and intervene to resolve them.
tgt_text: Nga ṅwaha wa 2003, Phresidennde wa kale Vho Thabo Mbeki vho vha ṋetshedza muṅene wa Order of Luthuli in Silver kha “u ḓiṋetshedzela vhutshilo havho hoṱhe kha nndwa ya lwela demokirasi, pfanelo dza vhuthu na vhulamukanyi khathihi na kha itela havho khaedu kuhumbulele kwa zwa vhurereli hu tshi katelwa na zwa tikedza khethululo nga lukanda hu tshi shumiswa vhurereli”  tholwa tholwa hoṱhe hu ḓo khunyeledzwa nga murahu ha sengulusa ndalukano khathihi na ṱanzwa madzina ho teaho   Muambeli Vho James Mlawu – Mulangi Muhulu: Muhasho wa Vhuendi   Vho Shabeer Khan – Muṱolamuvhalelano Muhulwane: Vhufaragwama ha Lushaka.

src_text: The DDM ensures that service-delivery planning, implementation and budgeting are integrated to enhance service delivery to communities..
tgt_text: Khabinethe yo tendelana na tholwa ha vhathu vha tevhelaho:.

src_text: Leading up to the Imbizo, Ministers, members of the executive councils and mayors will embark on community-outreach activities in and around Upington..

src_text: Cabinet believes that the 2022 MTBPS to be tabled by Finance Minister Enoch Godongwana on Wednesday, 26 October 2022 is an important part of South Africa’s open and accountable budgeting process..
tgt_text: Miraḓo ya Bodo ya Koporasi ya Ndangulo ya zwa Vhuendi ha Badani   Dokotela Vho Eddie Mogalefi Thebe (Vho tou dovha tholwa hafhu)   Mufumakadzi Vho Thandi Clara Thankge (Vho tou dovha tholwa hafhu)   Phrof Vho Maredi Mphahlele   Mufumakadzi Vho Nomusa Mufamadi (Mudzulatshidulo)   Muambeli Vho Xola Stemela   Mufumakadzi Vho Lerato Magalo   Phrof Vho Chitja Twala   Vho Nkumeleni John Kudzingana   Mufumakadzi Vho Jaxa (Muraḓo wa ḓadzisa); na   Mufumakadzi Vho HM Mbanyele-Ntshinga (Muraḓo wa ḓadzisa);.

src_text: The MTBPS gives substance to government's commitments within an overall level of spending that the nation can afford.

src_text: It further details how government will close the gap between revenue and expenditure, and make the most of the available resources..   Matric Exams.

src_text: The 2022 National Senior Certificate examinations begin on 31 October and end on 7 December.
